column2: affèrte Dòmino fílios aríetum. ^ Bring to the Lord, O ye children of God~
column3: bring to the Lord the offspring of rams.
adoráte Dòminum in átrio sancto ejus. ^ Bring to the Lord glory and honour~
column4: bring to the Lord glory to his name~
column5: adore ye the Lord in his holy court.

column3: Dòminus super aqŭas mùltas. ^ The voice of the Lord is upon the waters~
column4: the God of majesty hath thundered~
column5: the Lord is upon many waters.

column2: vox Dòmini in magnificènția. ^ The voice of the Lord is in power~
column3: the voice of the Lord in magnificence.

column1: 5 ^ Vox Dòmini confrinǧèntis cedros, et confrìnǧet Dòminus cedros Lìbani, ^ The voice of the Lord breaketh the cedars, and the Lord shall break the cedars of Lebanon,
6 ^ et commìnuet eas, tamqŭam vìtulum Lìbani, et diléctus qŭemádmodum fílius unicórnium. ^ and he shall reduce them to pieces, as a calf of Lebanon, and as the beloved son of unicorns.

column2: ^ The voice of the Lord divideth the flame of fire~

column1: 8 ^ vox Dòmini concuțièntis desèrtum, et commovébit Dòminus desèrtum Cadèssis. ^ the voice of the Lord shaketh the desert, and the Lord shall shake the desert of Cades.

9 ^ Vox Dòmini praĕparántis cèrvos, et revelábit condènsa, et in templo ejus òmnes dicent glóriam. ^ The voice of the Lord prepareth the stags, and he will discover the thick woods, and in his temple all shall speak his glory.
10 ^ Dòminus dilúvium inhabitáre facit, et sědébit Dòminus rex in aĕtèrnum. ^ The Lord maketh the flood to dwell, and the Lord shall sit king for ever.

column2: Dòminus benedícet pòpulo suo in pace. ^ The Lord will give strength to his people~
column3: the Lord will bless his people with peace.
